    • Constructor Detail

      • VirtualStorageDynamic

        public VirtualStorageDynamic()
        Empty constructor that creates a storage with zero capacity.

        This constructor is provided only to satisfy the Entity contract.
        You should use VirtualStorageDynamic(long) though.

      • VirtualStorageDynamic

        public VirtualStorageDynamic(long capacity)

      • setParent

        public void setParent(Entity parent)
        Description copied from interface: Entity
        Updates the parent of this entity.
        This method makes sure that the old and the new parent keep their entities list updated, by automatically calling Entity.addEntity(Entity) and Entity.removeEntity(Entity).

        A CoreNotificationCodes.ENTITY_PARENT_CHANGED notification is thrown.
        Additionally, each descendant of this entity (ie: entities who have this entity as their direct or not direct parent) are notified using CoreNotificationCodes.ENTITY_ANCESTOR_CHANGED.

        Specified by:
        setParent in interface Entity
        Overrides:
        setParent in class EntityImpl

        Description copied from interface: StorageFile
        This method is called by a StorageOperation when it is stopped.
        Specified by:
        dealWithOperationDeactivation in interface StorageFile
        oldCompletedLength - the completed length before this operation is started. This can be used to compute newly completed length during current run (using operation.getCompletedLength() - oldCompletedLength).

      • getPlacementPolicy

        public SfPlacementPolicy getPlacementPolicy()
        Description copied from interface: StorageFile
        Returns the SfPlacementPolicy that was used when placing this StorageFile in the current storage. null is returned if this StorageFile has no defined SfPlacementPolicy.
        Specified by:
        getPlacementPolicy in interface StorageFile
        Returns:
        the SfPlacementPolicy that was used when placing this StorageFile or null

      • setPlacementPolicy

        public void setPlacementPolicy(SfPlacementPolicy policy)
        Description copied from interface: StorageFile
        This method is called by SfPlacementPolicy when placing this StorageFile on a storage.

        You should not need to call this method if you are not implementing a placement policy.

        Specified by:
        setPlacementPolicy in interface StorageFile

      • unplace

        public void unplace()
        Description copied from interface: StorageFile
        Unplaces current StorageFile using current set SfPlacementPolicy, or sets a null parent for current VM if no SfPlacementPolicy was set.
        In both situations, this method guarantees that the current StorageFile's parent will be set to null. Because this may take time, you need to listen to CoreNotificationCodes.ENTITY_PARENT_CHANGED to know when all actions have been taken.

        If you only want to set a null parent for this StorageFile then use Entity.setParent(Entity). Which will set the null parent immediately.

        Specified by:
        unplace in interface StorageFile

      • getUser

        public User getUser()
        Description copied from interface: StorageFile

        Specified by:

        the User that owns this StorageFile
